fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8996].
  {panel}

When specifying link tips, I am allowed to add text as typed in the link. I would like to add a macro like say {excerpt} instead of static text.

Let me explain with an example

My main page:

This is the link to a [nice term|Glossary#pain in the wazoo|myLinkTipText] in my product glossary.

In my Glossary page:

{excerpt:pain in the wazoo}
Explanation of pain in the wazoo

What I would like to do is "myLinkTipText" should be a variable that points to the explanation from my glossary which shows up as a tool tip. 

Now why dont I type the explanation itself in the tool tip? Well thats because I use the same explanation from many pages and I dont want version madness when I change the explanation.

Am I making sense? If not pls ask for more explanation and I will attempt to explain better.

fields.description:
----

Input in the Feed Builder is not properly handled.

Insert: 
{code}
"><<script>alert('Gotcha!')</script>
{code}
as the feed name (title) and you get url like this:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/dashboard/doconfigurerssfeed.action?types=page&types=blogpost&types=mail&types=comment&types=attachment&sort=modified&showContent=true&showDiff=true&spaces=conf_global&labelString=&rssType=atom&maxResults=10&timeSpan=5&publicFeed=true&title=%22%3E%3C%3Cscript%3Ealert%28%27Gotcha%21%27%29%3C%2Fscript%3E

Suggested fix: Escape output of title in
{code}<link rel="alternate" type="application/atom+xml" title="" href=""/>{code} in the {code}/dashboard/doconfigurerssfeed.action{code} view

fields.description:
We get an ImportExportException while exporting a space to PDF.
The error is reproducable.
We have several Spaces in our wiki. This error happens only in this one space. In teh other spaces the PDF export works fine.
Maybe a problem with some not 100% clean wiki code / wiki markup on a page inside this space? The stacktrace gives no info what page produces the error.

fields.summary: Make changing of space logo cluster safe

fields.description:
Confluence currently stores the entire contents of textual attachments (like word, txt and powerpoint documents) in the search index. This is done mainly to produce excerpts that display in search results. 

During index optimization the bodies of attachment are read from the disk into memory in bulk (meaning a block of memory equal to the size of all indexed & stored attachments is requested from the heap). With enough large attachments, the JVM will be asked for a large block of heap it cannot allocate and an OutOfMemoryError is produced.
fields.summary: Index rebuild tasks involving an index optimization produce an OutOfMemoryError when there are many large textual attachments

fields.description:
I realize this is totally lame, but mostly I wanted to see if I win a prize for noticing the hilarity in the notation guide {userlister} section. In the little example graphic:

Tyler Durden (tdurden@example.com)
Marla Singer (marla@example.com)
Robert Paulsen (bob@example.com)

Awesome. But "Paulsen" is misspelled, it's supposed to be "Paulson".

I must be off my rocker for noticing that, but it's just another reason Atlassian rocks.


-matthew

fields.description:
When using the excerpt-include macro to display a portion of a page, images in the excerpted portion of the page are not displayed. If the entire page is included, the images appear with no problem.
I've included markup for 2 pages I created in the demonstration space to illustrate the problem:

{noformat}
--------Example With Excerpt---------

A sentence before the excerpt.

{excerpt}
A sentence in the excerpt, followed by an image - also in the excerpt.

!Confluence Overview^harbour.jpg!\\ 
{excerpt}

A sentence after the excerpt.
-----end of page------

-------Including Content---------

*The following content includes an excerpt containing and image from of another page.*
{excerpt-include:Example With Excerpt|nopanel=true}
\\

*The following content includes the entire content of the same page.*
{include:Example With Excerpt}
\\
-----end of page------

fields.description:
When LDAP connection pooling is configured, the individual LDAP binds that verify a user's ID/password do not utilize the LDAP connection pool.  Instead, a new connection is created and terminated directly after the LDAP bind is attempted.  Here is an example LDAP trace showing the connection pool start up and the new connection(s) created for the user's bind attempt.

{code:title=Creating Connection Pool of 10 LDAP connections}
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97000 from 172.20.240.95:1840, monitor = 0x73, index = 7
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97540 from 172.20.240.95:1841, monitor = 0x73, index = 8
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97620 from 172.20.240.95:1842, monitor = 0x73, index = 9
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97700 from 172.20.240.95:1844, monitor = 0x73, index = 10
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea977e0 from 172.20.240.95:1843, monitor = 0x73, index = 11
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea979a0 from 172.20.240.95:1845, monitor = 0x73, index = 13
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97a80 from 172.20.240.95:1846, monitor = 0x73, index = 14
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97b60 from 172.20.240.95:1847, monitor = 0x73, index = 15
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97c40 from 172.20.240.95:1848, monitor = 0x73, index = 16
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97d20 from 172.20.240.95:1849, monitor = 0x73, index = 17
{code}

{code:title=Using the first connection of the connection pool for operations with the application's bind ID}
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0001:0x60) DoBind on connection 0x9ea97000
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0001:0x60) Bind name:cn=bindid,o=base, version:3, authentication:simple
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0001:0x60) Sending operation result 0:"":"" to connection 0x9ea97000
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0001:0x60) Operation 0x1:0x60 on connection 0x9ea97000 completed in 0 seconds
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0002:0x63) DoSearch on connection 0x9ea97000
[2007/07/16 15:31:17] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0002:0x63) Search request:
{code}

{code:title=User Logs in and a new connection is created to bind as the user, even though there are still 9 unused connections in the connection pool}
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] New cleartext connection 0x9ea97ee0 from 172.20.240.95:1850, monitor = 0x73, index = 19
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0001:0x60) DoBind on connection 0x9ea97ee0
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0001:0x60) Bind name:cn=testuser,ou=USERS,o=base, version:3, authentication:simple
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0001:0x60) Sending operation result 0:"":"" to connection 0x9ea97ee0
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0001:0x60) Operation 0x1:0x60 on connection 0x9ea97ee0 completed in 0 seconds
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0002:0x63) DoSearch on connection 0x9ea97ee0
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0002:0x63) Search request:
.....
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1850)(0x0002:0x63) Operation 0x2:0x63 on connection 0x9ea97ee0 completed in 0 seconds
{code}

{code:title=First connection of the LDAP connection pool is used again for subsequent searches by the application bind ID}
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0009:0x63) DoSearch on connection 0x9ea97000
[2007/07/16 15:31:33] (172.20.240.95:1840)(0x0009:0x63) Search request:
...
{code}

{code:title="Extra" connection created for the user bind is closed with a TCP Reset, which causes the LDAP server to close the connection with an error}
[2007/07/16 15:31:46] Monitor 0x73 found connection 0x9ea85ee0 socket closed, err = -5871, 0 of 0 bytes read
[2007/07/16 15:31:46] Monitor 0x73 initiating close for connection 0x9ea85ee0
[2007/07/16 15:31:46] Server closing connection 0x9ea85ee0, socket error = -5871
[2007/07/16 15:31:46] Connection 0x9ea85ee0 closed
{code}

My guess would be that the function that verifies the user's password does not utilize the LDAP connection pool and simply creates a new connection itself.

fields.description:
Even when email addresses should be hidden because of global settings, it is possible to retrieve email addresses of all the users in the system by (mis)using search in people directory.

It seems that the email address is one of the attributes that are being indexed by the search engine. So if one searches for "j\*@\*" he will see users with email address matching this expression listed in the search result. If this user iteratively tries to add another letter after "j", e.g. "jo\*@\*" and keeps on tuning the expression based on the search results, he can find out the whole email address for e.g. user Joe, which is joe_doe@yahoo.com

This process can be automated using a script and it should be theoretically possible to retrieve all the email addresses for all users in a matter of minutes.

Suggested fixes:
1) don't index email addresses if the "hide email addresses" setting is on
2) index only the part of the email address that is before @. e.g. for email address joe_doe@yahoo.com, index only joe_doe
fields.summary: People Directory search can be misused to retrieve email addresses of all users

fields.description:
If a space or a site admin or other other user is watching a space, they should receive email notifications even for changes marked as minor.

This is important because users could make changes that they know an admin or a person responsible for the content would not approve, but since no notification is send to the admins when this change is marked as minor, it is very likely that the change will be left unnoticed.

There are two ways this could be implemented:

1) Via user preferences. If a user sets in the user preferences that he/she wants to receive minor updates then this would apply for all spaces/pages he/she watches.

2) Via watch button - There could be two icons, one for normal watch and another one for watch that notifies about minor chages. Alternatively the watch icon could cycle through three states: Watch -> Watch + minor changes -> Stop watching.
fields.summary: Email notifications of minor changes should be send to users who opt in

fields.description:
Currently email notifications contain rendered pages as they looked right after the change that triggered the notification was submitted.

This is not very helpful because if a space admin is watching a space, (s)he has to click on "(View changes)" link in each email to see what has actually changed.

It would be much better if each user could set in Email Preferences if he wants to receive diffs or pages rendered in usual way.

The diff should use the same format as diffpages.action e.g. http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=151144&originalId=144452

If user wants to receive emails in text format, the diff should have format similar to unix diff command.
fields.summary: Watch emails (change notifications) should contain html diffs

I've attached 4 screen shots to show the problem.

I feel it is not intuitive how the paragraph styles are applied when using the rich text editor. 

Basically the problem is that when you select a paragraph heading from the box, it will display the formatted heading but this will be in the paragraph AFTER the current cursor location. So when you begin typing you end up still typing in the old paragraph style and not in the new heading paragraph style.

In Word, if you select a new style it is applied to wherever the current cursor location is.

fields.description:
When two requests from the same LDAP user hit the ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator very close together, one of the requests can fail due to the unique constraint (also called "violated key error") on the EXTERNAL_MEMBERS table.

We don't have an effective way of preventing multiple requests hitting these check-then-create sections in Confluence. It needs a locking strategy which relates to the resource being updated: in this case, a particular user and group.

*Workaround:*

Do nothing. These errors will only occur sometimes when an LDAP user logs in to your wiki for the first time. There should be no effect, except perhaps for an error screen which can be cleared by refreshing the browser.
fields.summary: ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator shows errors in logs: unique constraint violation in EXTERNAL_MEMBERS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8937].
  {panel}

In corporate environments where Confluence is used to bridge internal and external communities or groups of users, it is often undesirable to let internal users acting as space admin grant space admin permission to external users.

We need to control who can became a space admin, without too much maintenance overhead (running nightly jobs checking permissions). Currently a space admin can intentionally or unintentionally grant space admin permission to anyone.

It would be great if  *space* admins could grant space admin permission to other users, but only to users from a group (or multiple groups) defined by *site* admins. 

Example:
Let's say that we have three groups: admins, employees, wiki-users. 

We'd like to let admins specify (via site admin interface) that only employees can become space admins. When a space admin configures the permissions, (s)he should not have an option to grant admin privileges to any other group than the employees group and to individual users that don't belong to this group. Obviously it should not be possible to grant space admin privileges to the anonymous user/group.
fields.summary: An option to allow space admins only from a specified group(s)

fields.description:
Most new instances of Confluence must be populated with users and group from an external user repository, or occasionally new users must be created from scratch. It would be useful to have a new page in the Administrator's Guide linking the available options with a short blurb explaining when to use each.

- LDAP / Active Directory
- NTLM for Windows Domain logon
- JIRA
- Crowd for external user repositories
- Scripts to create new groups, then create new users and add them to those groups via XML-RPC
fields.summary: Document the approaches to importing and creating users and groups

fields.description:
When there are "too many" comments on a confluence page or blog, a link to "show all comments" is shown.  It doesn't show all comments though.  It seems to show the start of all threads and have links to "View the rest of this thread". 

I guess if the initial link said "show all comment threads" (if that's genuinely what it does) I would find this less annoying.  

Generally though I think a link to "show next N comments" at the end of the comments would suit me better.  having to show all comments then show all the comments in each thread is a really irritating way to have to read them.
fields.summary: Show All Comments Doesn't

fields.description:
As you can see at attachement july.png, there are three news for this mounth. There is a 'blog-posts' macro used on page with number of displayed item limited to one (see attachement blog-posts.png). The oldest news is displayed instead of the latest one.

It can be important, that 'blog-posts' macro is used on a page two times: the second occurence is displayed on attached screenshot blog-posts-5.png and it is highlighted by green color in source code.
As you can see, news added on July 11 and July 16 are not displayed again.

fields.description: Email sent from Igor: {quote} The problem: The input for space name and key is not being validated properly. I created a JIRA for lacking length validation (CONF-8894) and later on I noticed that any characters in the input for space name are allowed. Combine that with another batch of bugs - space name output is not being sanitized in: * breadcrumb * dashboard * browse space -> advanced * spaceadmin - remove space confirmation page * Site Search page * some other places? And you get a recipe for XSS attack that can effect the whole confluence instance not just one space. The result: Anyone with create space privileges or any space admin (even without space creation privileges) can create/rename the space to something like: This will invoke a javascript in a user's browser when this user views the space, dashboard, search page or potentially other pages. This script could do malicious things like e.g. assign site admin privileges to the malicious user when the exploited page is viewed by a site admin, change user profile, post comments on behalf of the victim, etc.. {quote}
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability: space name and key not validated nor escaped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8915].
  {panel}

 Presently,emailing a page includes the subject prefix by default.Users need to specifically enter the subject.It would be nice if we have a way wherein we can enable the facility to automatically insert the page name in the "subject" field.
 Also it would be nice if the name of the user who has sent the page gets reflected in the "From" field too,so that the name of the user can be spotted in the email client.Currently,the configured name (e.g support@company.com) gets reflected in the email clients,and so it gets difficult to spot out who has sent the mail,so at times the mail gets ignored.

 In our organization (Cadence Design Systems),we have received this request from a large number of users.We would appreciate if such a feature rolls out in your future versions.

Thanks,
Pranav.
fields.summary: Include page name in the "subject" field when emailing a page,and reflect name of the user in the "From" field so that users can see the person name in their email clients

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8913].
  {panel}

When a trackback is received from a JIRA instance, it is only displayed in the 'Incoming Links' section of the 'Info' tab. When users are closely integrating JIRA and Confluence, they may wish to make an associated JIRA issue appear prominently on the 'View' page tab. 

An option should be available under the Confluence 'Administration > Shortcut Links' page to display trackbacks from JIRA instances under the Labels on the view tab, if that JIRA instance has a shortcut, eg @JIRA.

Added by ... last edited by ... on ....  (view change)
Labels: (None) EDIT 
JIRA Issue/s: CONF-123, JRA-123

This will make associated JIRA issues easier to find.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA issue integration by displaying trackbacks from JIRA instances on the View page tab

fields.description:
I enabled the html macro for my personal site. On a page I used this macro from the WYSIWYG editor to insert some HTML that included several
tags. That tag is correctly-formatted XHTML, in the sense that it doesn't leave any open XML tags lying around. However, the WYSIWYG editor doesn't seem to like it: when I opened the page in the WYSIWYG editor again, the tag had changed to

which is wrong. FireFox 2.0.0.3 (at least) renders

as two separate line breaks, which isn't what I wanted. Some more experimentation showed that the problem seems to be in the module that transforms Wiki markup into HTML on the way into the WYSIWYG editor: editing the page with the Wiki Markup editor set as the default shows the original
tag, but then switching to the WYSIWYG editor shows the new (wrong)

pair. HOW TO REPRODUCE: 1. Set the Wiki Markup editor as your default. 2. Enable the HTML macro. 3. Edit a page and insert this text, but change the parens to braces: (html) First line
second line (html) 4. Save this page and view it. You will see just one line between "first line" and "second line." 5. Edit the page (in the Wiki Markup editor). You will see no change - the original
tag is there. 6. Switch to the WYSIWYG editor. Now you will see that the tag has changed to

which is not correct. 7. Save the page from the WYSIWYG editor and view it. Under FireFox 2.0.0.3 (at least) you will see a blank line between "First line" and "second line" which isn't what I wanted. This bug probably applies to all sorts of XHTML that uses the syntax to open and close a tag in a single XML element. For some of them it's harmless but for
it changes the rendering in at least one browser.
fields.summary:
WYSIWYG editor turns
into

inside HTML macro

fields.description:
This is related to [CONF-7628] but it's not fixed in version 2.5.4.

When I use the WYSIWYG editor and place a macro on a line of text, I can save the page and it renders just fine. But then if I edit the page in the WYSIWYG editor again, something is adding newlines around the macro. This means I can't use a macro "in-line" with other text.

HOW TO REPRODUCE:

1. Edit a page with the WYSIWYG editor and add this text, using braces instead of "<>":
    Before <metadata-from:Parent> after.

2. Save and view the page: it will look right, with the word "Before," then the macro expansion, then the word "after" all on one line.

3. Now edit the page again with the WYSIWYG editor. You will see multiple newlines around the macro's braces, like this:

Up to
<metadata-from:Parent>

 
my parent page.

If you save the page without making any changes, the page will render with the newlines, so now you see "Before," then a line break, then the parent page's name, then another line break, then the word "after."

Unlike earlier reported bugs, repeated WYSIWYG editing at this point does not add any additional line breaks. But this bug does mean you can't use "in-line" macros like this; macros can only be used with line breaks around them. This limits the usability of the WYSIWYG editor.
fields.summary: Newlines get added around macros in WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
My team has been unable to use svn.atlassian.com for the last few days. I submitted a ticket yesterday, but had to submit the ticket under Confluence since there was no way to submit a ticket with svn.atlassian.com. I thought of some suggestions that might help:

* Could add a way to submit trouble tickets for svn.atlassian.com and repository.atlassian.com. That way you could track the issue and get emails when it was resolved or any work was done on it.

* Emails could be sent to the developer lists hosted by atlassian when svn.atlassian.com or repository.atlassian.com were down, and daily status emails sent when they are down stating either when they'd be back up or when the next status email would be sent, and then again email sent when they are back up.

* For planned outages, it would be good to have at least a few weeks notice via email to developer list and maybe another email sent one day before the outage.

* It would be great to have some server status page hosted by atlassian too that had this information. The link could be sent in the email and also available on the atlassian site somewhere.

Unfortunately we're going to have to move to hosting our plugin project locally until the current issue is fixed, but maybe these suggestions might help in the future.

Thanks,
Gary
fields.summary: Ways to handle svn.atlassian.com and/or repository.atlassian.com being down/coming back up/planned outages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8898].
  {panel}

It would be great if Confluence would do the following to better recover when confluence.cfg.xml is corrupted by the application (as appears to happen when the application process is killed, etc.):

    * Immediately before confluence writes to confluence.cfg.xml, it could copy confluence.cfg.xml to confluence.cfg.lastgood (that is just an example name- may want to come up with something better)

    * If confluence starts up and confluence.cfg.xml is empty or unreadable, it attempts to copy confluence.cfg.lastgood to confluence.cfg.xml, and then loads confluence.cfg.xml

This is not the same as the existing request in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8435 because I'm not suggesting that the confluence.cfg.xml have any more than one backup of the last successfully loaded config. This is the way that weblogic servers handle configuration files (at least in 8.1.5 that's how it was done) and it seems to work well and be very useful (I think the extension they use is "boot", but I don't think that would be appropriate in this case).

IMO, this would make Confluence much more robust.
fields.summary: Make single backup copy of confluence.cfg.xml immediately before any writes to it by the application. Application should be able to restore from backed up copy if it gets corrupted.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8897].
  {panel}



Both of these methods doesn't fit exactly.
We had big problems upgrading from CONF 2.2.9 to 2.5.4 importing our 2 GB data (mainly attachments) and 100 Spaces. Backup over zip file doesn't work anymore. Methods described in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence didn't fit either.

Probably some other admins have the same problem and no solution.

What we tried now is:

1. stop server
2. Backup to zip without attachmentss
3. empty Database (MySQL)
4. move the content of /data/confluence/attachments (nearly 2 GB!) to outside of Server so that /attachments is empty (important)
5. deploy new confluence.war
6. start server
7. run setup with restore of backup from 2.
8. move the content of /data/confluence/attachments back to the Server
9. run search index

This steps seems to lead to the right result. Some tests are required now.
fields.summary: Upgrading 2 GB data from 2.2.9 to 2.5.4

fields.description: Since upgrading from 2.5.3 to 2.5.4 I find that any new users I create are unable to add pages despite having full rights in the space in which the page add operation is attempted.  These users can edit pages, access attachments, and create news, but they receive a "Not Permitted" error message when they attempt to add a new page.  Placing these users into the confluece-admin group solves the problem, but, of course, this assignment will not be appropriate in most cases.
fields.summary: "Not Permitted" error for new users when attempting to create page although have full rights in space

fields.description:
For some time now we have had complaints from some of our customers that the icons used in our menus never seem to be cached ... various fixes have been implemented by atlassian however unfortunatley none of them seem to have been 100% effective. 

In my own testing, using firebug pointed at a server running confluence 2.5.3 and builder 3.0 I got the following results:

    *  when you refresh (f5) a page, all of the icons are reloaded
    * If you click into the address bar and use return to refresh the page, the icons come from the cache.
    * If you click on the page title in the breadcrumbs to refresh the icons come from the cache.
    * If you click on another page in the breadcrumbs(eg the parent), the icons come from the cache.
    * If you click back to the original page, the icons come from the cache.
    * If you click back the icons come from the cache.
    * If you click forward the icons come from the cache.

However ... when I came back to re-test those results a second and third time I found that whether the images come from the cache or not is also reliant on the amount of time passed between the initial page load and the refresh/reload

Dan recently found a tool (http://www.ircache.net/cgi-bin/cacheability.py) which can check a page's cacheability and this is what it has to say about plugin resources :

-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------
http://test.wiki-neon.adaptavist.com/download/resources/com.adaptavist.confluence.themes.sitebuilder:sitebuilder/icons/printer.png
Expires -
Cache-Control private
Last-Modified 16 hr 47 min ago (Wed, 11 Jul 2007 02:46:21 GMT) validation returned same object
ETag "1184121981000"
Set-Cookie jsessionid=Ij2GFRbUVobCb1Z2or; path=/
Content-Length - (actual size: 806)
Server Resin/3.0.18

This object doesn't have any explicit freshness information set, so a cache may use Last-Modified to determine how fresh it is with an adaptive TTL (at this time, it could be, depending on the adaptive percent used, considered fresh for: 3 hr 21 min (20%), 8 hr 23 min (50%), 16 hr 47 min (100%)). It has a validator present, but when a conditional request was made with it, the same object was sent anyway. It won't be cached by proxies, because it has a Cache-Control: private header. This object requests that a Cookie be set; this makes it and other pages affected automatically stale; clients must check them upon every request. It doesn't have a Content-Length header present, so it can't be used in a HTTP/1.0 persistent connection.
-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------

Hopefully that should be of some use in resolving this long-standing issue ... thanks for all your effort on this so far, I think we are probably pretty close to getting it licked, its just that last 10% eh?
fields.summary: Caching of plugin resources ocurrs erratically
